thread.title: No, Danny Miller isn't leaving his Emmerdale role as Aaron Dingle | Metro News
thread.title_full: No, Danny Miller isn't leaving his Emmerdale role as Aaron Dingle | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: No, Danny Miller isn't leaving his Emmerdale role as Aaron Dingle | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 10:54 am (Picture: ITV) 
The future is looking grim for Aaron Dingle following his wedding to Robert Sugden in Emmerdale as an unpleasant twist will see him sentenced to 12 months in prison following his attack on Kasim. 
And some reports have jumped the gun somewhat over this and speculated that this will form an exit storyline for Danny Miller, leaving fans unsettled that they are about to lose their favourite character from the show. Emmerdale spoilers: 14 pictures from Robert Sugden and Aaron Dingle’s wedding 
But have no fear – Danny and Aaron are going nowhere. In fact, it’s quite the oppositte. We are sworn to secrecy for the moment, but future plot details are suggesting that we will be seeing more of Aaron, if anything. 
While a prison sentence often means a character going off screen, taking a break or leaving for good, Aaron’s journey behind bars will be followed on screen and we will be able to give you some strong new details on what’s ahead on Sunday 19th February. 
Metro.co.uk recently visited the Emmerdale set for a catch up with Danny, his co-star Ryan Hawley (Robert) and the series producer Iain MacLeod. (Picture: ITV) 
And we are safe to assure you that there are big plans ahead for the characters and any current rumours of Danny leaving the role should be dismissed. 
Check back on our soaps homepage on Sunday 19th February from 7am (we know, early rise on a Sunday!?) for brand new interviews, storyline gossip and maybe even a sneaky new picture or two. You can also follow our busy soaps Facebook page here.
